summary: This is an FBI 302 interview report of a Senior Officer Specialist at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, conducted on August 20, 2019. The officer, whose attorney was present, provided information about her duties, general prison procedures, and her observations and lack of specific knowledge regarding Jeffrey Epstein on August 9, 2019, the day of his death.

persons.name: Natali Todd
persons.context: Attorney for the Senior Officer Specialist being interviewed. Present during the FBI interview at the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate at MCC. The interview focuses on the officer's observations of him on August 9, 2019, and general procedures related to his housing.

connections.description: Todd was the attorney representing the unnamed Senior Officer Specialist during her voluntary interview with the FBI and AUSA.

events.title: Epstein's Activities on Day of Death
events.description: The interviewed officer recalls seeing Jeffrey Epstein around 9am in the attorney conference area with 3-4 attorneys. She also worked as acting Lieutenant from 4pm-10pm that day and visited the SHU, noting regular operations.

events.title: Epstein's Prior Suicide Attempt
events.description: The officer states she only heard things in passing regarding Epstein's alleged suicide attempt in July 2019.

events.title: FBI Interview of MCC Officer
events.description: A Senior Officer Specialist from MCC is interviewed at the U.S. Attorney's Office, with her attorney present, regarding prison procedures and her observations related to Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), 150 Park Row, New York, New York
United States Attorneys Office (USAO), Southern District of New York (SDNY), 1 St. Andrews Plaza, New York, New York
keyFacts: The interviewed officer saw Jeffrey Epstein with 3-4 attorneys (2 females, 1 male) in the conference area around 9am on August 9, 2019.
The officer stated she was not in the SHU when Epstein returned from the attorney conference and does not remember anyone talking about a phone call Epstein made that day.
The officer has no knowledge of how Epstein's cellmates were selected or the specific procedures for an inmate coming off suicide watch.
Count paperwork at MCC is kept in the Control Center for 30 days before being shredded.
The interview was conducted under a proffer agreement and in lieu of a grand jury appearance.
